Title: Astro Boy
Original title: Astro Boy
Country: USA, Japan
USA release: 23/10/2009
Released in Spain: 24/09/2010
Released on DVD (rental): 15/12/2010
DVD release (sale): 14/12/2010
Blu-ray release: 14/12/2010
Genre: Animation
Length: 94 Min
Studio: Summit Entertainment
Director: David Bowers
Writer: Timothy Harris (character by Osamu Tezuka)
Starring: (Voices) Nicolas Cage, Kristen Bell, Donald Sutherland, Nathan Lane, Bill Nighy, Eugene Levy, Matt Lucas, Freddie Highmore, Samuel L. Jackson, Charlize Theron.
Rating: Suitable for all audiences


Synopsis:
Metro City, a futuristic world in a glittering metropolis space, the year 2108. After losing her son Toby, the brilliant scientist Dr. Tenma tries to replace him with Astro Boy, a robot with a child's body and endowed with extraordinary human feelings superpowers: X-ray vision, a great artificial intelligence and rockets in his boots and arms. The heart of Astro Boy is made by the Core Blue, a source of extremely powerful positive energy that makes it the main objective of the military troops President Stone, obsessed with getting the Core Blue to create the robot Peacemaker, who despite its innocuous name has been designed as a robot to dominate the earth. Astro Boy will soon embark on an adventurous journey to confront his identity and his destiny: to save the earth.

Production notes:
Awaited film adaptation of legendary manga created by the father of Japanese animation, Osamu Tezuka.

Directed by David Bowers (Flushed Away) and a budget of over $ 50 million, ASTRO BOY is a superhero film set in the future that tells the story of a boy-robot with incredible powers who embarks on a journey full of adventures to confront his identity and destiny.

ASTRO BOY is produced by Maryann Garger (Flushed Away) and Cecil Kramer (Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the vegetables) among others.
